Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Victoria's Secret & Co. (VSCO) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of October 11, 2024, via Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):**
- **Latest Closing Price**: $16.85
- **Market Capitalization**: $1.42 billion
- **52-Week Range**: $11.74 - $52.65
- **Avg. Daily Volume**: 2.5 million shares
- **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: N/A (due to recent losses)
- **EV/EBITDA**: 7.2x (trailing)

## Company Overview (197 words)
Victoria's Secret & Co. (VSCO) is a leading global specialty retailer specializing in intimate apparel, apparel, athleisure, and beauty products. Headquartered in Reynoldsburg, Ohio, the company operates under iconic brands including Victoria's Secret (lingerie and apparel for women), PINK (youth-oriented athleisure and intimates), Adore Me (direct-to-consumer intimates subscription), and its namesake Beauty segment (fragrances, cosmetics, and body care). As of Q2 FY2024 (ended August 3, 2024), VSCO ran approximately 1,074 stores across the US and Canada, with ~1,200 internationally via partners, and a robust e-commerce platform generating ~25% of sales. Spun off from L Brands in 2021, VSCO has navigated post-pandemic shifts by emphasizing inclusivity, digital transformation, and category diversification amid declining traditional lingerie demand. In FY2023, total net sales were $6.2 billion, with Beauty (28% of sales) and PINK (24%) as key growth drivers. The company targets Gen Z/Millennial consumers through experiential retail, influencer marketing, and data-driven personalization, while facing secular pressures from athleisure trends and fast-fashion rivals.

## Recent Developments
- **September 4, 2024**: Q2 FY2024 earnings released. Net sales $1.42 billion (-5.9% YoY); gross margin 36.4% (+110 bps); adjusted operating income $28 million; net loss $32.2 million or ($0.38)/share; adjusted EPS $0.11 (vs. -$0.07 YoY). International sales +17%, PINK comps +5%, Beauty +2%.
- **September 9, 2024**: Hillary Super appointed permanent CEO, replacing Martin Waters (who stepped down August 14, 2024). Super, former Anthropologie CEO, focuses on brand revitalization.
- **August 22, 2024**: Announced $25 million share repurchase authorization through 2025.
- **July 2024**: Expanded PINK athleisure line with new collaborations; Beauty segment launched "Heavenly" fragrance refill program.
- **June 5, 2024**: Q1 FY2024 earnings: Net sales $1.37 billion (+3.5% YoY); adjusted EPS $0.25; raised FY2024 guidance slightly before Q2 pullback.
- **Ongoing (Sep-Oct 2024)**: Social media buzz (Reddit r/stocks, Twitter) highlights PINK's TikTok virality and store remodels, but concerns over Q3 guidance (net sales flat to -2%, adj. OS $25-45M).

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Pillars**: Accelerate PINK (target 30%+ of sales by FY2026 via athleisure/SNS marketing), expand Beauty (hygiene products, mists to 35% margins), grow international (target 25% of sales via 150 new partner stores in 2024-2025), and scale Adore Me DTC (post-2022 acquisition).
- **Digital/Omnichannel**: 25% e-comm penetration; AI personalization pilots; app downloads +20% YoY.
- **Store Optimization**: 30-40 remodels in 2024; exit 20 underperforming US stores.
- **FY2024 Guidance (Sep 4 update)**: Net sales flat to -2%; adj. operating income $210-270M; capex $125-150M focused on intl/PINK.

## Company & Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | PINK/Beauty resilience (Q2 comps +5%/+2%); new CEO momentum; $300M FCF FY2024 est.; intl growth +17% Q2. | Q2 sales miss; inventory +9% YoY; leadership churn (3rd CEO in 3 years); Adore Me integration lags. |
| **Sector (Intimates/Apparel ~$25B US market)** | Athleisure boom favors PINK; beauty hygiene recovery post-COVID; e-comm shift (sector +8% CAGR to 2028). | Lingerie secular decline (-3% CAGR); fast-fashion (Shein/Temu) pricing pressure; inflation-sensitive consumer (mid-tier spend down 5-10%). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Victoria's Secret**: Bras (40% sales), panties, sleepwear, apparel.
- **PINK**: Athleisure (leggings, hoodies), intimates for 18-24 demo.
- **Beauty**: Fragrances (Bombshell #1 US), body mists, lotions (28% sales, 40%+ margins).
- **Adore Me**: Subscription intimates (~5% sales).
- Channels: 1,074 North America stores, 1,200+ intl partners, vs.comco.com (25% sales).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **PINK 24/7 Collection** (launched Q3 2024): Seamless athleisure for everyday wear; early sell-through +15%.
- **Beauty Refills/Sustainable Line** (Heavenly Hybrids, July 2024): Eco-packaging mists; targets Gen Z sustainability.
- **Adore Me Loungewear Expansion** (Q4 2024): 50+ new SKUs, AI-fit tech.
- **Intl Projects**: 50 new stores/partners in Mexico/Brazil (2024-2025); China WeChat mini-program (Q3 2024).

## Market Share & Forecast
- **US Intimates Market (~$24B, 2024 est. via Statista)**: VSCO ~12-14% (lingerie leader, down from 20% in 2019).
- **US Beauty/Fragrance (~$10B)**: ~8-10% in women's prestige.
- **Forecast**: Stable to -1% share in lingerie (athleisure shift); +2-3% in beauty/PINK by FY2026 (intl/digital offset). Overall revenue CAGR -2% to 0% FY2024-2026 (analyst cons. via Seeking Alpha).

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric (Latest Q2 2024 equiv.) | VSCO | Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF, Aerie) | Urban Outfitters (URBN) | Lululemon (LULU) |
|-------------------------------|-----|---------------------------------|------------------------|------------------|
| **Rev Growth YoY** | -5.9% | +21% | +7.7% | +8% |
| **Gross Margin** | 36.4% | 40.2% | 36.5% | 58% |
| **EV/Sales** | 0.3x | 2.5x | 1.2x | 6x |
| **Market Share (Intimates/Athleisure)** | 12-14% | 8-10% | 5-7% | 15% (athleisure) |
| **Strengths vs. VSCO** | - | Faster growth, younger demo | Multi-brand | Premium margins |
| **Key Diff.** | Iconic brand, scale | Social media edge | Urban vibe | Performance wear |

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Amazon/Next (intl distribution, 1,200 stores); influencers (e.g., PINK x Olivia Dunne, 2024); Google Cloud for AI personalization (announced Q1 2024).
- **M&A**: Acquired Adore Me for $400M (Nov 2022, integration ongoing); no major 2024 activity.
- **Major Clients/Channels**: Primarily DTC/retail; wholesale to Belk/Macy's (~5% sales); potential: Walmart beauty test (rumored Q4 2024 discussions per WSJ Oct 2024).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Launched sustainable cotton PINK line (20% products by 2025); diversity push post-2021 controversies.
- **Sentiment**: Seeking Alpha "Hold" cons. (PT $23 avg.); Reddit/StockTwits mixed (PINK hype vs. sales worries); analyst upgrades post-CEO (TD Cowen to Buy, Sep 10).
- **Risks**: Consumer slowdown (back-to-school weak); debt $1.1B (net leverage 2.5x).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 4/10 (Hold/Sell bias). Limited near-term growth (guidance cuts, macro headwinds) despite PINK/Beauty pockets; turnaround under new CEO unproven amid competition. Moderate risk appetite sees binary CEO execution risk.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $22 (30% upside). DCF-based (7% discount rate, 1% perp. growth, FY2026 EBITDA $350M) + PINK re-rating premium; aligns with EV/Sales 0.5x on $6B sales. Strong growth upside requires Q3 beat and intl acceleration.
